soc.client

Class SOCAccountClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • soc.client.SOCAccountClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SOCAccountClient
extends java.applet.Applet
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Applet/Standalone client for connecting to the SOCServer and making user accounts.

    This account-management client will connect to server version v1.1.19 and higher (SRV_VERSION_MIN). The required minimum version simplifies logic and assumptions about available SOCFeatureSet. If needed to manage older servers, older client JARs can be downloaded or built from git release tags.

    To connect the applet to a non-default server port, you must specify it as the port parameter in the html applet tag. If you run SOCAccountClient as a stand-alone app, specify the server's hostname and port on the command line.

    Author:
    Robert S Thomas
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • SRV_VERSION_MIN

        public static final int SRV_VERSION_MIN
        Minimum server version (v1.1.19) to which this account-management client will connect; see class javadoc.

        Same format as Version.versionNumber(). Same value as SOCFeatureSet.VERSION_FOR_SERVERFEATURES.

        Since:
        1.1.20
        See Also:

      • cliLocale

        final java.util.Locale cliLocale
        Locale for i18n message lookups used for strings. Also sent to server when connecting. Override if needed in the constructor by reading the PROP_JSETTLERS_LOCALE JVM property "jsettlers.locale".
        Since:
        2.0.00

    • Constructor Detail

      • SOCAccountClient

        public SOCAccountClient(int displayScaleFactor)
        Create a SOCAccountClient connecting to localhost port 8880 (ClientNetwork.SOC_PORT_DEFAULT).
        Parameters:
        displayScaleFactor - Display scaling factor to use (1 if not high-DPI); caller should call SwingMainDisplay.checkDisplayScaleFactor(Component) with the Frame to which this display will be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if displayScaleFactor < 1

      • SOCAccountClient

        public SOCAccountClient(java.lang.String h,
                        int p,
                        int displayScaleFactor)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for connecting to the specified host, on the specified port. Must call 'init' to start up and do layout.

        The SOCAccountClient GUI's own localized strings use the current user's default locale, unless overridden by setting the PROP_JSETTLERS_LOCALE JVM property "jsettlers.locale".

        Parameters:
        h - host
        p - port; JSettlers default is 8880 (ClientNetwork.SOC_PORT_DEFAULT)
        displayScaleFactor - Display scaling factor to use (1 if not high-DPI); caller should call SwingMainDisplay.checkDisplayScaleFactor(Component) with the Frame to which this display will be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if displayScaleFactor < 1

      • handleSTATUSMESSAGE

        protected void handleSTATUSMESSAGE(SOCStatusMessage mes)
        handle the "status message" message. If this is in response to authrequest when connecting, show MAIN_PANEL. If we've just created a user (SOCStatusMessage.SV_ACCT_CREATED_OK), clear the password fields: must re-enter if creating another.
        Parameters:
        mes - the message
